block.p: Carolina Madeline Kuczynski and Darren Wesley Reid were married yesterday at Estherwood, a house on the grounds of the Masters School in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Melvin Hawthorne, an ecumenical minister, performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Reid, 35, is the vice president for strategy at Answerthink.com, an Internet consulting and development firm in New York. She graduated from Dartmouth College and received an M.B.A. degree from Insead, the business school in Fontainebleau, France. Her mother, Jane Casey Hughes of Washington, is a cultural correspondent there for the Voice of America. The bride's father, Pedro Pablo Kuczynski of Miami, is the chief executive of the Latin American Enterprise Fund, a Miami-based mutual fund.

Carolina Madeline Kuczynski and Darren Wesley Reid were married yesterday at Estherwood, a house on the grounds of the Masters School in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Melvin Hawthorne, an ecumenical minister, performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Reid, 35, is the vice president for strategy at Answerthink.com, an Internet consulting and development firm in New York. She graduated from Dartmouth College and received an M.B.A. degree from Insead, the business school in Fontainebleau, France. Her mother, Jane Casey Hughes of Washington, is a cultural correspondent there for the Voice of America. The bride's father, Pedro Pablo Kuczynski of Miami, is the chief executive of the Latin American Enterprise Fund, a Miami-based mutual fund.

Mr. Reid, 36, is the chief executive of ROI Lab, a New York company that builds Internet sites. He graduated from Oklahoma State University at Stillwater, where his father, Dr. Karl Reid, is the dean of the College of Engineering, Architecture and Technology. The bridegroom's mother, Dr. Verna Lou Reid, has a family-therapy practice in Stillwater.
